Key Match Events: Terceros scored the winning goal for Bolivia in the 58th minute.
Miranda scored in the 90+3' for Bolivia.
Cuellar was sent off for Colombia in the 21st minute.
Castano scored for Colombia in the 51st minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Bolivia have one of the youngest and inexperienced squads in South America.
Colombia are unbeaten in their last 13 meetings with Bolivia, winning 10.
Colombia are yet to lose in regular time under Nestor Lorenzo.
Bolivia will be seeking a fourth win in five qualifiers, but Colombia are expected to win.
Post-Match Reflections: Colombia maintained their unbeaten record under Nestor Lorenzo.
Bolivia picked up a crucial win to stay in contention for qualification.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bolivia's new home venue, Estadio Municipal El Alto, is even higher above sea level than the infamous Estadio Hernando Siles in La Paz.
Colombia struggled in the altitude, having won on just two of their last eight visits.
Others: Bolivia's historic victory away in Chile was their first on the road in qualifying in 67 matches, since a 7-1 win against Venezuela in 1993.
